Name: Gristle Golem
Description: A semi-sentient heap of regenerative tissue harvested from the pits of the Under-Labs.

Name: Zinc Mosquito
Description: These metallic parasites thrive in industrial zones, drinking leaked hydraulic fluid.

Name: Shatter-Star
Description: A crystalline organism born from the high-pressure atmosphere of a dying gas giant.

Name: Obsidian Sentinel
Description: Ancient volcanic rock imbued with a primitive, aggressive nervous system.

Name: Vibe Checker
Description: An astral entity that feeds exclusively on the emotional frequencies of nearby creatures.

Name: Oil Slick
Description: An accidental mutation of ocean sludge, now capable of mimicry and basic locomotion.

Name: Anvil Drop
Description: Massive, gravity-sensitive boulders carved into symbols of weight by ancient earth-cults.

Name: Riot Grrrl
Description: A sub-culture of sound-wielding humans who use sonic vibrations to disrupt physics.

Name: Dread Lobster
Description: A crustacean from the Trench Era; its shell is reinforced with tectonic mineral deposits.

Name: Papercut Pixie
Description: Fae creatures composed of fibrous cellulose, hiding in plain sight among old scrolls.

Name: Concrete Dog
Description: Stone-based hounds originally sculpted as guardians, brought to life by stray magic.

Name: Banshee DJ
Description: A spectral species that communicates through rhythmic, ear-shattering frequency loops.

Name: The Janitor
Description: A specialized class of workers trained to handle hazardous multidimensional waste.

Name: Magma Mutt
Description: Canines made of molten silicate; they pant smoke and leave trails of scorched glass.

Name: Static Cat
Description: Felines that act as natural capacitors, storing lightning in their fur during storms.

Name: Velvet Vampire
Description: Noble parasites who wear organic, sentient silk capes to camouflage their true forms.

Name: Hungry Hole
Description: A wandering rift in space-time that lacks a physical body but possesses a ravenous ego.

Name: Neon Nomad
Description: Cybernetic survivors who have replaced 90% of their organic parts with glowing light-tubes.

Name: Lead Belly
Description: Heavy-set dwarves whose internal organs have been replaced by a functional smelting furnace.

Name: Fever Dream
Description: Paradoxical beings that only exist when a sentient mind enters a state of deep delirium.

Name: Pesticide Pal
Description: Chemical-warfare specialists who have lived in hazmat suits for so long they cannot breathe air.

Name: Basement Troll
Description: A sub-species of subterranean cave-dwellers that evolved to hunt by the glow of phosphor.

Name: Balloon Popper
Description: A bird with a beak designed specifically to puncture tight surfaces.

Name: Sleepy Panda
Description: An old discarded pail that has spent too much time in the rain forest.

Name: Soul Taxer
Description: A bureaucratic race of demons who manage the flow of energy between various hell-realms.

Name: Gravity Moth
Description: Insects that generate their own localized mass, making the air around them feel like lead.

Name: Cinder Child
Description: Small, glowing embers that have taken on a humanoid shape to stay warm in the cold.

Name: Drunken Master
Description: Fighters who use fermented nectar to enter a state of unpredictable, fluid combat.

Name: Memory Leak
Description: A digital virus that has manifested in the physical world as a glitching, unstable knight.
